intro: Antimima lokenbergensis, commonly known as the Lokenberg's antimima, is a rare succulent native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, characterized by its fleshy, water-storing leaves and adaptations to arid environments. The plant typically grows in rocky outcrops and sandy soils, thriving in full sun. Its small, star-shaped flowers are usually pink or purple, blooming during the cooler months. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
